intro: Pleurothallis capitonis, commonly known as the "Capitonné orchid," is a species native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized orchid with a compact growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically has a pseudobulb and linear, fleshy leaves that help it store water in its natural habitat. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and delicate flowers, it is a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
